The 2025 Oregon Connections Telecommunications Conference brought more than 255 participants to Hood River for two days of learning, discussion, and connection. Broadband leaders, policymakers, and innovators from across Oregon gathered to share insights and advance the state’s work toward reliable, high-speed connectivity for all communities. This year’s agenda featured sessions on the Broadband Equity,…

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
For a growing business, the decision to move from leasing to owning commercial real estate (CRE) represents a major strategic inflection point. While leasing offers flexibility and capital preservation in the short term, ownership is a powerful long-term tool for stability, wealth creation, and operational control. Once the decision to buy is made, securing the…

articles.description: DINT detectives arrested 38-year-old Chet Evans of Myrtle Creek in Roseburg after finding suspected fentanyl, meth residue, and weapons. Evans faces drug and weapons charges and remains in custody on a Lane County probation detainer.

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Jason Nathaniel Briggs, 43, of Roseburg, was arrested Oct. 28 on a charge of first-degree sexual abuse and later released on bail. Court records show three no-contact orders were issued. He’s due back in court Dec. 15 for a status hearing. The case remains under investigation.
articles.title: Roseburg Man Arrested, Released on Bail in First-Degree Sexual Abuse Case

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Fire crews extinguished a semi-truck fire on I-5 southbound near Winston Thursday morning. The blaze started in the engine compartment and spread to the cab and trailer loaded with paper rolls. No injuries were reported, and the cause is under investigation.
articles.title: Southbound I-5 semi-truck fire near Winston extinguished

articles.description: A notice of appeal has been filed in the case of Jonathan Dowdy, sentenced to over 20 years for the fatal UCC softball team bus crash. Records show his sentence matched the plea agreement, and his earliest possible release date remains March 22, 2044.
articles.title: Appeal Filed in Fatal UCC Softball Team Crash Case

articles.description: Grants Pass re-awarded a $1.2 million homelessness grant to Roseburg’s Elk Island Trading Group, which plans to build a container-home village for 150 people by summer 2026. The project could help the city close unmanaged camps and meet shelter space requirements.

articles.description: The 32nd annual Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights opens Nov. 23 at River Forks Park! Enjoy over half a million lights, 90+ displays, the World’s Largest Nutcracker, and the Dutch Bros Holiday Village. Open nightly at 5:30 p.m. through Jan. 1. More at UVFestivalofLights.com.
articles.title: Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights Returns for 32nd Year

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg’s iconic “Green Bridge” has reopened after months of rehabilitation work, but it’s now black. Crews completed repairs, deck upgrades, and repainting to extend the bridge’s life and improve safety, restoring a key route between Stewart Parkway and the VA Medical Center.
articles.title: Stewart Park “Green Bridge” Reopens - and It’s No Longer Green

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: UCAN is reopening the Roseburg Warming Center for a third winter, offering warmth, food, and shelter during freezing nights. The center opens when temps drop to 30°F or below. Volunteers and donations are needed—sign up at housinghomelessservices.as.me/volunteerorientation.
articles.title: UCAN Preparing to Open Roseburg Warming Center for Third Winter

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County deputies arrested 43-year-old Jason Nathaniel Briggs on Oct. 31 for first-degree sexual abuse, a Class B felony. Investigators say the victim, a minor known to Briggs, reported years of abuse. He remains in the Douglas County Jail.
articles.title: Douglas County Man Arrested on Felony Sexual Abuse Charge

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg Grocery Outlet’s planned 10% discount for SNAP recipients was blocked by the USDA, but owners Steve and Kelly Burton found a workaround—partnering with FISH Food Pantry to offer 10% off cards to anyone in need throughout November, no verification required.
articles.title: USDA Blocks SNAP Discount, but Roseburg Grocery Outlet Finds a Way to Help

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County will again take part in Operation Green Light this November, lighting the courthouse green to honor veterans and their families. Residents are encouraged to join by displaying a green light at home to show gratitude and support for those who have served.
articles.title: Douglas County Joins Operation Green Light to Honor Veterans

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Douglas County Search and Rescue located two missing men in separate incidents last week. A Myrtle Creek hunter was found safe Friday morning, and an Eugene man stuck in the Umpqua National Forest was located Sunday evening in good health after being stranded for four days.
articles.title: Douglas County Search and Rescue Locates Two Missing Men

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: November 4, 2025

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Detectives from the Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team (DINT) made a significant arrest Wednesday following suspected drug activity in Roseburg.
articles.title: Myrtle Creek man arrested in Roseburg on drugs and weapons charges

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: A local man faces serious charges after an investigation into alleged sexual abuse.
articles.title: Roseburg man arrested for long-term sexual abuse of minor victim
